notes_display: Counterfeit detector printed on thick blue paper. Distributed by Hall and Sellers to banks as a proof note to be compared with suspected counterfeit notes.
issue_place_s: Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, United States of America
issue_obverse_figure_description_s: Seal of a thirteen level pyramid with motto PERENNIS (Everlasting).
issue_obverse_legend_s: The United States | Continental Currency 50 | Fifty Dollars. | This BILL entitles the Bearer to receive Fifty Spanish milled Dol-lars, or the Value thereof in Gold or Silver, according to a Resolution passed by CONGRESS at Philadelphia, Sep-tember 26th, 1778. 50 DOLLARS.
issue_reverse_figure_description_s: Imitation nature print of three arrows.
issue_reverse_legend_s: FIFTY DOLLARS | Printed by HALL and SEL-LERS. 1778.
